_source.text: 5. Natural Gas is a fossil fuel and while it is a little better than coal it still has a large carbon impact.

text: 5. Natural Gas is a **fossil** fuel and while it is a little **better** **than** coal it still has a large **carbon** impact.

_source.text: A carbon fork is better because it will fail quicker?

text: A **carbon** **fork** **is** **better** because it will fail quicker?

_source.text: A carbon tax that reflects the cost of global warming back onto the industry will shift energy usage from fossil fuels to sustainable ones better than subsidies.

text: A **carbon** tax that reflects the cost of global warming back onto the industry will shift energy usage from **fossil** fuels to sustainable ones **better** **than** subsidies.

_source.text: A "better than nothing" trade in feel-good carbon credits dodges the real issue: How much longer can our planet tolerate our fossil-fuel fueled mobility?

text: A "**better** **than** nothing" trade in feel-good **carbon** credits dodges the real issue: How much longer
can our planet tolerate our **fossil**-fuel fueled mobility?

_source.text: 4) Things (solar, wind) that everyone agrees are good, or at least very much better than fossil fuels, may not progress and become available on a global basis soon enough to reduce global carbon emissions below critical threshold levels;

text: 4) Things (solar, wind) that everyone agrees are good, or at least very much **better** **than** **fossil**
fuels, may not progress and become available on a global basis soon enough to reduce global **carbon** emissions below critical threshold levels;

_source.text: After all, Kotick knows better than anyone else how little of the market is represented by the kind of people who post on forums and comment threads - and Activision's recent triumph with Guitar Hero 5, effortlessly outselling The Beatles Rock Band, just goes to prove that huge amounts of noise and attention aren't necessarily meaningful.

After all, Kotick knows **better** **than** anyone else how little of the market is represented by the kind
outselling The Beatles Rock Band, just goes to prove that huge amounts of noise and **attention** aren't necessarily meaningful.
